clusters.title: A timeline of Erik and Lyle Menendez’s case over the last three decades
clusters.neutral_headline: Erik Menendez Denied Parole, Lyle's Hearing Scheduled

items.title: A timeline of Erik and Lyle Menendez’s case over the last three decades
items.standfirst: Lyle Menendez will face parole board a day after brother Erik was denied release. Follow every key event from arrest to parole hearings 35 years laterErik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday after serving decades in prison for killing his parents. Lyle Menendez, his brother, will be next to get a chance to plead his case in front of a panel of California state parole board commissioners.Erik and Lyle Menendez were sentenced in 1996 to life in prison for killing their father, José Menendez, and mother, Kitty Menendez, in their Beverly Hills mansion in 1989. They were 18 and 21 at the time. Defense attorneys argued the brothers acted out of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father, while prosecutors said the brothers killed their parents for a multimillion-dollar inheritance. Continue reading...
items.content: Lyle Menendez will face parole board a day after brother Erik was denied release. Follow every key event from arrest to parole hearings 35 years laterErik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday after serving decades in prison for killing his parents. Lyle Menendez, his brother, will be next to get a chance to plead his case in front of a panel of California state parole board commissioners.Erik and Lyle Menendez were sentenced in 1996 to life in prison for killing their father, José Menendez, and mother, Kitty Menendez, in their Beverly Hills mansion in 1989. They were 18 and 21 at the time. Defense attorneys argued the brothers acted out of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father, while prosecutors said the brothers killed their parents for a multimillion-dollar inheritance. Continue reading...

items.title: Lyle Menendez to face California parole board after brother Erik denied freedom
items.standfirst: Erik will be eligible after three years as two brothers have spent 30 years in prison for the murder of their parents Lyle Menendez is set to face a California parole board a day after his brother was denied freedom after spending 30 years in prison in the slaying of their parents inside their California mansion.A panel of two California commissioners denied Erik Menendez parole for three years, after which he will be eligible again, in a case that continues to fascinate the public. A parole hearing for his brother Lyle Menendez, who is being held at the same prison in San Diego, is scheduled for Friday morning. The commissioners determined that Menendez should not be freed after an all-day hearing during which they questioned him about why he committed the crime and violated prison rules. They rejected parole despite strong support from family members who have advocated for the brothers’ release for months. Continue reading...
items.content: Erik will be eligible after three years as two brothers have spent 30 years in prison for the murder of their parents Lyle Menendez is set to face a California parole board a day after his brother was denied freedom after spending 30 years in prison in the slaying of their parents inside their California mansion.A panel of two California commissioners denied Erik Menendez parole for three years, after which he will be eligible again, in a case that continues to fascinate the public. A parole hearing for his brother Lyle Menendez, who is being held at the same prison in San Diego, is scheduled for Friday morning. The commissioners determined that Menendez should not be freed after an all-day hearing during which they questioned him about why he committed the crime and violated prison rules. They rejected parole despite strong support from family members who have advocated for the brothers’ release for months. Continue reading...

items.title: Erik Menendez denied parole, decades after killing parents
items.standfirst: Menendez, along with his brother Lyle, has served 35 years of a life prison term for fatally shooting their parents.
items.content: Menendez, along with his brother Lyle, has served 35 years of a life prison term for fatally shooting their parents.

items.title: Erik Menendez's parole denied three decades after parents' murder
items.standfirst: Erik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said, three decades after being jailed for life – along with his brother Lyle – for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989. The pair say they acted in self-defense after years of emotional and sexual abuse at the hands of a tyrannical father.
items.content: Erik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said, three decades after being jailed for life – along with his brother Lyle – for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989. The pair say they acted in self-defense after years of emotional and sexual abuse at the hands of a tyrannical father.

items.title: Erik Menendez denied parole after decades in prison

items.content: California officials have denied Erik Menendez parole after he spent decades in prison for killing his parents in 1989.

items.title: Erik Menendez denied parole three decades after killing his parents

items.content: The younger of the Menendez brothers, who killed their parents in their Beverly Hills mansion, can try again for parole in three years.

items.title: Erik Menendez denied parole three decades after parents’ 1989 murder
items.standfirst: Erik Menendez, serving a life sentence with his brother Lyle for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989, was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said. The brothers have been in prison for 35 years for the shotgun slayings.
items.content: Erik Menendez, serving a life sentence with his brother Lyle for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989, was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said. The brothers have been in prison for 35 years for the shotgun slayings.

items.title: Watch: Moments from the Menendez brothers trial in 1993

items.content: Erik and Lyle, who are serving prison sentences for the murders of their parents, are making their case for parole this week.

ai_summary: Erik Menendez was denied parole after serving decades in prison for killing his parents in 1989.
Lyle Menendez, his brother, will have a parole hearing the following day in the same prison.
The brothers were sentenced to life in prison in 1996 for the murders in their Beverly Hills mansion.
Erik will be eligible for parole again in three years after the denial by the parole board.
The parole board rejected Erik's release despite support from family members advocating for their release.

Continue reading...

items.title: Thai court clears ex-PM Thaksin of royal defamation charges
items.standfirst: A Thai court on Friday cleared former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charges, saying there was not enough evidence to prove wrongdoing. The case stemmed from decades-old remarks Thaksin made in South Korean media that prosecutors said violated Thailand's strict laws prohibiting insults against its royal family.
items.content: A Thai court on Friday cleared former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charges, saying there was not enough evidence to prove wrongdoing. The case stemmed from decades-old remarks Thaksin made in South Korean media that prosecutors said violated Thailand's strict laws prohibiting insults against its royal family.

ai_summary: A Thai court acquitted former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charges on Friday.
The case could have resulted in a prison sentence of up to fifteen years for Thaksin.
The lese-majeste charge related to an interview Thaksin gave to a South Korean newspaper.
The court dismissed the case, stating there was insufficient evidence to prove wrongdoing.
Thaksin's daughter faces a separate case that could impact her role as prime minister.

clusters.title: Colombia hit by deadly guerrilla attacks, at least 18 killed
clusters.neutral_headline: Deadly Guerrilla Attacks in Colombia Kill Eighteen

items.title: Colombia hit by deadly guerrilla attacks, at least 18 killed
items.standfirst: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups in Colombia killed 18 people and injured dozens on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, while a drone downed a police helicopter at a northern coca farm, worsening the country’s worst security crisis in decades and threatening fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections.
items.content: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups in Colombia killed 18 people and injured dozens on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, while a drone downed a police helicopter at a northern coca farm, worsening the country’s worst security crisis in decades and threatening fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections.

items.title: In Colombia, two separate guerilla attacks kill 18
items.standfirst: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups killed 18 people and injured dozens in Colombia on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, killing six and wounding more than 60, while a drone brought down a police helicopter at a coca farm in the north. The violence deepens Colombia’s worst security crisis in decades and threatens fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections. FRANCE 24'- Juan Pablo Lucumi has more from our offices in Bogota.
items.content: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups killed 18 people and injured dozens in Colombia on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, killing six and wounding more than 60, while a drone brought down a police helicopter at a coca farm in the north. The violence deepens Colombia’s worst security crisis in decades and threatens fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections. FRANCE 24'- Juan Pablo Lucumi has more from our offices in Bogota.

items.title: At least 18 killed and dozens injured in separate Colombia attacks

items.content: A car bomb killed six people in Cali while a downed police helicopter left 12 officers dead.

items.title: North Korea's Kim decorates 'heroes' who fought for Russia against Ukraine
items.standfirst: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un led an emotional ceremony decorating troops who fought against Ukrainian soldiers in Russia's Kursk region and honouring those who died, images released by state media on Friday showed. In a speech, Kim praised the "admirable" troops who had lost their lives facing "life-and-death war in the foreign country", state media reported.

items.title: Russia's foreign minister says no Putin-Zelenskyy summit planned despite Trump's peace push
items.standfirst: Russia’s top diplomat said Friday that no meeting is planned between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy, casting new doubt on President Donald Trump’s push for a summit to end the war.“Putin is ready to meet with Zelenskyy when the agenda is ready for a summit, and this agenda is not ready at all,” Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told NBC News’ “Meet the Press” moderator Kristen Welker in an exclusive interview
items.content: Russia’s top diplomat said Friday that no meeting is planned between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy, casting new doubt on President Donald Trump’s push for a summit to end the war.“Putin is ready to meet with Zelenskyy when the agenda is ready for a summit, and this agenda is not ready at all,” Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told NBC News’ “Meet the Press” moderator Kristen Welker in an exclusive interview

ai_summary: Russia's foreign minister stated no meeting is planned between Putin and Zelenskyy.
This casts doubt on President Trump's push for a summit to end the war.
Putin is ready to meet when the agenda is ready for a summit, according to Lavrov.
The agenda for a summit is not ready at all, according to the Russian foreign minister.

Why it matters: This is the first time that the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) has said famine exists in Gaza since the war began nearly…

items.title: UN-backed experts declare famine in and around Gaza City
items.standfirst: IPC says famine is ‘entirely man-made’ and immediate response is needed or avoidable deaths will soarIsrael-Gaza war – latest updatesAn “entirely man-made” famine is taking place in Gaza’s largest city and its surrounding area, UN-backed experts have declared, in an escalation of the devastated territory’s humanitarian crisis.The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC), a globally recognised organisation that classifies the severity of food insecurity and malnutrition, found that three key thresholds for famine had been met. Continue reading...
items.content: IPC says famine is ‘entirely man-made’ and immediate response is needed or avoidable deaths will soarIsrael-Gaza war – latest updatesAn “entirely man-made” famine is taking place in Gaza’s largest city and its surrounding area, UN-backed experts have declared, in an escalation of the devastated territory’s humanitarian crisis.The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC), a globally recognised organisation that classifies the severity of food insecurity and malnutrition, found that three key thresholds for famine had been met. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Famine is occurring in Gaza City and could spread to other areas.
The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) confirmed the famine.
This is the first time the IPC has declared famine in Gaza since the war began.
The IPC said the famine is "entirely man-made" and requires immediate action.
Israel has rejected the determination as fabricated and political.

items.title: Government to cover pay and pensions at collapsed South Yorkshire steelworks
items.standfirst: Unions receive assurances after state takes control of Liberty Steel plants that were put into administrationWorkers at the UK’s third-largest steelworks, in South Yorkshire, have been assured that they will receive their pay for August as well as unpaid pension contributions after a government-appointed special manager took over the collapsed company.Liberty Steel’s main British business, Speciality Steel UK (SSUK), was put into administration on Thursday afternoon after a high court judge ruled that it was insolvent and that its owner, the metals tycoon Sanjeev Gupta, had no prospects of repaying debts of several hundred million pounds. Continue reading...
items.content: Unions receive assurances after state takes control of Liberty Steel plants that were put into administrationWorkers at the UK’s third-largest steelworks, in South Yorkshire, have been assured that they will receive their pay for August as well as unpaid pension contributions after a government-appointed special manager took over the collapsed company.Liberty Steel’s main British business, Speciality Steel UK (SSUK), was put into administration on Thursday afternoon after a high court judge ruled that it was insolvent and that its owner, the metals tycoon Sanjeev Gupta, had no prospects of repaying debts of several hundred million pounds. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The government will cover pay and pensions at the collapsed South Yorkshire steelworks.

Liberty Steel's main British business was put into administration on Thursday.
The company's owner, Sanjeev Gupta, has no prospects of repaying debts.

items.title: Fed chair Powell to give high-stakes speech at Jackson Hole amid Trump attacks
items.standfirst: Jerome Powell – who Trump has urged to resign – will address the economic outlook at a symposium in WyomingFor months, the Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, has ignored demands from Donald Trump to cut interest rates and defied the US president’s calls to resign.On Friday, as Trump ramps up his extraordinary attack on the central bank’s independence, Powell will set out where he thinks the world’s largest economy is headed in a closely scrutinized speech at the Jackson Hole symposium in Wyoming. Continue reading...
items.content: Jerome Powell – who Trump has urged to resign – will address the economic outlook at a symposium in WyomingFor months, the Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, has ignored demands from Donald Trump to cut interest rates and defied the US president’s calls to resign.On Friday, as Trump ramps up his extraordinary attack on the central bank’s independence, Powell will set out where he thinks the world’s largest economy is headed in a closely scrutinized speech at the Jackson Hole symposium in Wyoming. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Fed Chair Powell will give a major speech at Jackson Hole, Wyoming.
The speech will address the economic outlook.
Trump has urged Powell to cut interest rates.
The Fed has not adjusted interest rates in eight months.
Powell will speak at an annual gathering.

clusters.title: Netanyahu pushes ahead with Gaza takeover
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu pushes ahead with Gaza takeover

items.title: Netanyahu pushes ahead with Gaza takeover
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is moving ahead with its planned takeover of Gaza City. He also signalled willingness to negotiate the release of Israeli hostages, but his remarks undermined hopes for a ceasefire deal proposed by Arab nations and accepted by Hamas earlier this week.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is moving ahead with its planned takeover of Gaza City. He also signalled willingness to negotiate the release of Israeli hostages, but his remarks undermined hopes for a ceasefire deal proposed by Arab nations and accepted by Hamas earlier this week.

items.title: Netanyahu says Israel will begin ceasefire talks with Hamas
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he is willing to restart ceasefire talks with Hamas in exchange for the remaining hostages being released. This comes as Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City, calling up 60,000 additional reservists. Protests erupted over news of the most recent offensive, with many hostage families saying this only endangered those still left in Gaza.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he is willing to restart ceasefire talks with Hamas in exchange for the remaining hostages being released. This comes as Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City, calling up 60,000 additional reservists. Protests erupted over news of the most recent offensive, with many hostage families saying this only endangered those still left in Gaza.

items.title: Netanyahu announces return to Gaza ceasefire negotiations
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said renewed ceasefire negotiations would go “hand in hand” with the planned expansion of military operations to take full control of Gaza City.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said renewed ceasefire negotiations would go “hand in hand” with the planned expansion of military operations to take full control of Gaza City.

ai_summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu said Israel will move forward with Gaza City takeover.
Netanyahu signaled willingness to negotiate the release of Israeli hostages.
His remarks undermined hopes for a ceasefire deal.
Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City.
Netanyahu announced renewed ceasefire negotiations.

items.content: Egypt on Thursday unveiled parts of a sunken city submerged beneath waters off the coast of Alexandria, revealing buildings, artefacts and an ancient dock, all dating back over 2,000 years.

clusters.title: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting
clusters.neutral_headline: Newsom approves California vote on maps

items.title: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting
items.standfirst: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.
items.content: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.

items.title: Newsom signs bill putting new California congressional maps on November ballot
items.standfirst: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has signed a bill that will allow voters to decide on new congressional maps in November. CBS News reporter Erica Brown has more.

clusters.title: Ukrainian national arrested over 2022 Nord Stream pipeline blasts
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukrainian arrested over Nord Stream blasts

items.title: Ukrainian national arrested over 2022 Nord Stream pipeline blasts
items.standfirst: Italian authorities have arrested a Ukrainian national suspected of coordinating and taking part in the 2022 sabotage of Nord Stream gas pipelines. The suspect, identified only as Serhii K., was arrested overnight in Italy’s Rimini province, at the request of German federal prosecutors. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.
items.content: Italian authorities have arrested a Ukrainian national suspected of coordinating and taking part in the 2022 sabotage of Nord Stream gas pipelines. The suspect, identified only as Serhii K., was arrested overnight in Italy’s Rimini province, at the request of German federal prosecutors. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

items.title: Ukrainian arrested in Italy over Nord Stream attacks, German prosecutors say
items.standfirst: Italian police have arrested a Ukrainian man suspected of coordinating attacks on the Nord Stream pipelines, Germany's prosecutor general said on Thursday.
